item.title: Data Analytics Architect
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Architect

Job Description

RBC is a digitally-enabled relationship bank. We strive to engage our customers when, how and where it’s most convenient and to provide a highly-personalized experience. We also collaborate broadly with innovative business and technology partners to create a platform and ecosystem that can bring even more value to our customers. We care deeply about the success of our customers and communities.

We’re looking for an experienced solution architect who is passionate about our mission to join the RBC Digital team. We want vocal futurists that can advocate their vision, who will be excited about creative problem-solving as part of a cross-functional team with customer focus and will strive for the best end-user experience in addition to having the drive and desire to keep learning the latest architecture developments, standards and techniques.

The primary focus of this position is to provide technology and architectural leadership with respect to the design and delivery of highly-scalable customer data and insights solutions leveraging machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) platforms.

This work will support development and delivery of information-intensive initiatives based on common practices for multiple complex projects.


What will you do?

  • Collaborate with business leaders to determine how to best apply technology to enable growth and success (e.g. scalable domain-driven solutions, operational reporting, SRE practices)
  • Provide architectural strategic thinking, information solutions, and input into roadmaps to drive delivery
  • Ensure architectural compliance of solutions and introduce recommendations for changes to reference model(s) when needed.
  • Maintain a plan to address gaps between current and target state architectures
  • Participate in \'reuse, buy and build\' decisions.
  • Understand potential impacts of proposed solutions on other systems, processes and/or projects
  • Articulate and document designs, considering trade-offs, costs, and benefits
  • Develop ongoing knowledge of current and emerging technologies
  • Identify new and emerging solutions, assess relevance and potential value to the organization, and present findings to teammates and management.
  • Participate in day-to-day execution of the architecture strategy
  • Develop blueprints and conduct design reviews to ensure architectural compliance of solutions.
  • Work across multiple projects and systems to develop, communicate, and mentor others on solution design, implementation and operation patterns and best practices

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Background in data architecture, analytics, and cloud native solutions
  • Experience with analysis techniques and measurement tools to continuously build valuable insights and business recommendations.
  • Strategic mindset with strong change management, continuous improvement and transformation skills
  • Strong technical skills in application development (data pipelines, services, streaming platforms)
  • Knowledge of identity and data access management and security best practices
  • Working knowledge in data acquisition, data storage & computational patterns with industry standard tools
  • Experience supporting mission-critical applications in production
  • Software engineering skills with distributed computing background and proven experience in delivering large-scale data platforms.
  • Good understanding of data fabric/mesh concepts and semantic layers

Nice to have:

  • Business or product leadership experience
  • Hands-on working experience with cloud native solution such as SnowFlake, DataBricks, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue/Lamba, RedShift, Azure DW.
  • Experience with next generation solution delivery on technologies such as Python, Kafka, Spark, Apigee, Jenkins; container solutions including Docker/Kubernetes; and private cloud platforms such as Openshift (OCP) or Pivotal (PCF)
  • Exposure to building and deploying predictive and prescriptive analytics models using any of the following: Python SciKit, R and Pytorch.
  • Experience with Salesforce (CRM), Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) and/or Palintir Foundry

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Member of the front-end chapter, which provides training, events, and other opportunities for learning. You will also have an opportunity to share your work and experience with your peers

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options​

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Analytics Lead
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Lead

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission.

What is the opportunity?

About Ventures Analytics

The Venture/Enterprise Analytics team solves strategic problems across the organization using a data-driven approach. We leverage data to unlock opportunities, influence strategy, assess the impact of business tactics and make relevant recommendations to the individual ventures, internal or external partners. Our team has seen massive growth since last year, and have provided tremendous value across RBC Ventures teams and RBC Lines of Business (LOB). In 2022, our priority is to expand the team to scale our services and provide opportunities for new team members.

What will you do?

  • Collaborate with Ventures and/or RBC’s external partners to understand core business goals and help achieve results through a data driven approach.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, dashboarding, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Develop strong relationships with your stakeholders to achieve superior business results and long lasting impact.
  • Communicate approaches & insights effectively to influence decision making at senior leadership levels.

What do you need to succeed?

Business acumen, curiosity, good communication, and strong technical skills.

Must have

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Data Science, Consulting).
  • Fluent in SQL (for analyses & creating reports) and predictive analytics in R or Python. 
  • Experience communicating analytics and Machine Learning results back to business partners and/or C-level.
  • An eager listener and a team player who is comfortable forming cross functional relationships with our partners.
  • We like to have fun and work with people who are passionate about analytics. We are looking for someone who thrives in a diverse and inclusive culture.

Nice to Have

  • Experience in improving business processes using ML is a big plus.
  • Experience publishing reports/dashboards, and visualizations with Tableau is a plus.
  • Leadership experience (in direct and/or indirect reporting capacity).
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, analytics)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • The opportunity to learn about the business models of a variety of ventures and RBC external partners
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

VSANALYTICS

RBC Ventures

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Developer

Job Description

What will you do? 
Refactor and consolidate analytics-related functionality.
Design robust API’s around common pieces of functionality, refactoring the code to support these new APIs, retire legacy code, and ensure that structural problems are also addressed during the refactoring.
Investigate and fix stability problems, determine what the fundamental solution should be, and prioritize accordingly.
Identify and address gaps in test coverage.
Interface with vendor systems, expose analytics to Excel and Risk systems.
Proposes the design and implementation of strategic analytics API’s.
Analyze and fix performance and stability problems in the internal analytics layers.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must Have:
Strong command of C++, Python or Java.
Expert in algorithms and data structures, object orientation, design patterns, and functional programming paradigms.
Excellent problem solving and quantitative skills.
Excellent API design, refactoring, profiling and code optimization skills.
Experience as a senior developer or team lead.

Nice to have:
Expertise with designing and supporting financial analytics API’s.
Experience with databases, distributed cache products, distributed and multithreaded computation, big data processing technologies such as Spark.
Experience with multiple platforms (Windows, Linux), compilers and tools for C++ development.
Experience with .Net.
Experience with build/test/release infrastructure.

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities   
Access to a variety of job opportunities across businesses and geographies

Job Summary

What is the opportunity?

As an Analytics Developer, you will develop our analytics infrastructure to make it more flexible, reliable, and performant. This role requires cooperation, coordination with quant, trading, and IT groups. You possess strong programming and API design skills.

Previous projects with low latency or high throughput analytics, and interest in financial products across asset classes would be preferred, but isn’t necessary.

item.title: Trading Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trading Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Capital Markets Technology, Equities group is seeking a Senior Software Developer to work on a Risk & Execution Services Applications supporting the Equity Derivatives trading desks. The platform stores risk analytics generated by a proprietary valuation engine and makes them available through a variety of interfaces to Traders. The applications also involve saving market data, running reports and analysis to serve the trading desk.

What will you do?

  • Work as a member of a global team to build Technology solutions used across the Equity and Equity Derivatives trading desks (Flow, DLO, STP, CED, CASH).
  • Create UI and interact with user to create the best user experience
  • Work with Capital Market UI Framework (React JS, Javascript, python)
  • Create Data providers to source data from various services (C#, python) to feed the UI
  • Design, develop, and maintain reusable Python, C# data loading, extracts and transformations.
  • Transition existing UIs into the new one
    • Back-End: C#/python – Docker/K8s deployment
    • Front-End: Web Application
  • Create Services and Rest endpoints for application
  • Work with Traders on daily applications and Implement solutions for their asks
  • Check-In code under source control (github/svn)
  • Create Build and Deployment Script (shell) on Jenkins
  • Scripts to source control Git/Docker/K8s

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ Years of Experience in Web Front-End Development (Javascript, React JS)
  • 3+ Years of Experience in Python
  • 3+ Years of OOO Development (Java, C#)
  • Experience with of UI/UX Styling
  • Knowledge of Database (SQL, Indexing, clustering, performance)
  • Knowledge of distributed architectures
  • Knowledge and understanding of Equity Derivatives
  • Experience with DevOps (Jenkins, etc)
  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm
  • Experience with REST, RPC, IDL
  • Understanding of Equity Derivatives and Risk frameworks
  • Basic understanding of Equity Derivatives Pricing, Greeks and Risk
  • Basic knowledge of statistical analysis (time series, linear regression)
  • Ability to adapt and learn new languages and Technology
  • Team work, ability collaboration with other groups/teams

Nice-to-have

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; ability to work in fast-paced environments delivering quality solutions
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Experience with C#

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, on progressive thinking to keep growing, and on working together to deliver trusted advice to our clients and help communities prosper.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with business stakeholders.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Sr Manager, Digital Analytics Implementation
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr Manager, Digital Analytics Implementation

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Analytics Platform & Innovation (AP&I) Squad within Canadian Data Asset (CDA) team is responsible for data collection and activation capabilities. In this role you will be responsible for strategically planning and managing successful deployment of the analytics capabilities within the digital banking channels. The role will prioritize, coordinate, develop, lead, communicate and execute activities to ensure an industry leading digital analytics practice within RBC.

What will you do?

  • Lead, manage and establish standards for digital analytics solutions within the digital channels
  • Establish strong working relationships across business units and platforms to build influence and impact with key business partners.
  • Collaborate with groups to define and achieve deliverables and ensure initiatives are effectively integrated into RBC procedures and processes.
  • Work with stakeholders to understand their business objectives and translate into analytics integration, technology strategy and requirements
  • Manage the implementation of multiple concurrent initiatives of varying complexity in a time efficient manner.  Monitor and control activities according to plan.  
  • Continuously identify potential issues, conflicts, and risks.  Analyze, mitigate and escalate where appropriate
  • Collaborate and contribute on cross-functional data initiatives and manage the effective implementation of assigned deliverables.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 4+ years of experience in digital analytics such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics, focusing on measurement of digital performance, data integration and development
  • Develop, customize and troubleshoot events and tags in complex environments with the use of JavaScript, XML, HTML and CSS.
  • Experience with third-party libraries and APIs
  • Familiarity with software lifecycle including application development, debugging, performance, security and deployment
  • Has experience in one or more of the following areas: digital analytics, optimization, statistical modeling, consumer insights, and/or marketing analytics
  • Demonstrated ability in written and oral communication skills along with strong presentation skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the stakeholders and project.

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Firebase, CDP Tag Management tool
  • Experience with one or more of Swift, Ajax, REST, JSON, Angular.js, Node.js, REACT
  • SCRUM and AGILE development practices

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Manager, Analytics Implementation & Optimization
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Analytics Implementation & Optimization

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Manager, Analytics Implementation & Optimization will play a key role within Insurance and the Data & Information team by supporting proactive expense management, building expense literacy, providing NIE and cost study analytics, as well as internal business communications support to various areas within RBC Insurance. This role will primarily be responsible for leading and developing a sustainable Expense Hygiene practice within Insurance, and expanding this practice across other RBC platforms, to continually identify opportunities to reduce expenses and build expense management and stewardship as a core competency within the organization.

What will you do?

• Provide day to day operational support and SME advice to all Operations Operating Committee (OOC) members including Operational Effectiveness, Operational Risk, Project Delivery & Digital Transformation, Operational Partnerships and Creditor Operations by enabling leaders to identify expense related knowledge gaps, streamline and promote consistency in expense processes (monthly eDHR and BVR reviews, completing annual NIE and Cost Studies, etc.)

• Leverage data, analytics and ingenuity skills to continually and proactively identify opportunities to reduce unnecessary expenses and work with key business partners across RBCI to execute on the removal of these expenses

• Promote expense literacy and hygiene as a core competency within Insurance and build out processes, resources, tools and practices to promote active expense management

• Leverage best practices from expense hygiene initiatives within Insurance and promote across other RBC platforms (i.e. Wealth Management, Capital Markets, etc.)

• Curate and analyze various expense and HR data sources in order to actively identify cost reduction opportunities, bring these opportunities forward and partner to execute the removal of expenses as well as track, measure and validate expense reduction attributed to expense management efforts across RBC Insurance for Leadership team and Finance

• Partner and collaborate with expense delegates from departments across RBCI to establish and instill expense maintenance into regular activities and partner with Finance to accurately and appropriately track Expense Hygiene initiatives through the Enterprise Efficiency Dashboard

What will you need to succeed?

Must-have:

• University degree or equivalent and 4 to 7 years of operational business experience

• Proven leadership, stakeholder and change management experience within Insurance Industry

• Proven ability to impact and influence and execution excellence skills

• Good understanding of RBC financial reporting, budget planning and sound knowledge of multiple RBCI business platforms

• Strong facilitation, communication and presentation skills using new on-line tools and technology

• Decision making, critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills

Nice to Have:

• Change Management certification

• Lean Six Sigma certification

• Experience in the Insurance industry

What\'s in it for you?

• A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans

• Competitive pay and high-earning potential

• All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your career

• Flexible work/life balance options

• Sophisticated RBCI software tools to boost your productivity

item.title: Manager, CBO Analytics & Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, CBO Analytics & Reporting

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Design and develop innovative reporting solutions which are both tactical and strategic to monitor operational performance, present key analytical and business insights to underlying drivers, and support leaders in managing operations and identifying opportunities to deliver operational efficiencies and drive an exceptional client experience.
  • Identify appropriate data sources and perform ETL for data modelling, data quality assessments, understand patterns and provide the basis to inform the reporting solution which provides meaningful operational insights.
  • Participate in conversations with internal partners to understand their business processes and objectives in order to define/recommend reporting solutions to meet those objectives, effectively communicate project status and develop relationships to ensure satisfaction.
  • Participate in design and solution review demonstrations with the Senior Manager and/or internal partners at critical tollgates to ensure adherence to requirements, resolve obstacles, while mitigating deployment risk and the need for post-deployment modifications,
  • Test and validate (QA) new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements
  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases.
  • Collaborate within Reporting COE to deliver advanced data visualizations that measure key indicators, disclose trends, provide proactive actionable insights/indicators and address business questions.
  • Be a thought partner within the Reporting COE team, supporting the developments of insights, processes, data approaches/ methodologies and information that is valued by partners across Canadian Banking Operations.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering, related field or equivalent related experience.
  • Experience in statistical methods, strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining, ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leaders and inform strategic decisions.
  • Demonstrated ETL and data modeling capabilities, and programming experience with large databases/datasets (using tools such as Python, Datameer, SQL Server, and Teradata and WebFocus).
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL
  • Experience in end to end development of automated reporting solutions
  • Expert technical documentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience. 

Nice-to-have

  • Proficiency in developing reports using data visualization tools (most notably Tableau).
  • Programming/coding skills in the following would be an asset
    • SAS
    • Java Script

Job Summary

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will work closely with Digital Platform Product Owners, LOB Product Owners, Marketing and Sales teams, and Senior Management to structure analyses, uncover analytic insights, develop net new data assets, build dashboards and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

In this role you will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end implementation of the analytics lifecycle - data collection, deep dive insight analytics, reporting and presentations.

You will provide objective, value-added insights and analysis to enable product owners to make strategic data-driven decisions. The person in this role will build critical understanding of RBCs products and the associated client behaviours to help deliver business value. The delivery of business value in this role comes from a combination of knowledge transfer to key stakeholders and the provisioning of data services and tests to client facing applications. 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:

    • Execute analytics plans on large data sets representing the behaviors, demographics and product attribute of prospects and clients. 

    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as causal inference, time series analysis, and hypothesis testing to find actionable insights

    • Develop and test hypotheses on data and data models

    • Based on evidence, make recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to support strategies and drive decisions

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:

    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition

    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions

    • Find, clean and structure data

    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes

  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:

    • Support the creation of Business Intelligence reporting that can be automated using reporting tools

    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance

    • Help construct presentations in story format

    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports and presentations identifying trends, issues and opportunities 

  • Stakeholder Consultancy:

    • Support relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems using a variety of analytical approaches and methodologies.

    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones. Manages stakeholder expectations and keeps them up-to-date with project statuses.

    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • 5+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role

  • Proven analytics and problem solving skills

  • Strong drive and desire to understand relationship of organizational components

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field

  • Advanced experience with SQL, Python, or Scala

  • Knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research.

  • Strong team player with track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Spark, Scala, Hive, Python is a preferred

  • Good understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue

  • Experienced with Jupyter Notebooks, IntelliJ, Visual Studio Code other notebook environments

  • Experience working in Unix/Linux environments

  • Experience working as part of an agile team using Github and JIRA

  • Experience with digital data collection tools such as Google Analytics

  • Knowledgeable in data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         

  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businesses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

You will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. You will be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required and  should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.  

What will you do?

  • Develop indepth knowledge of the current and strategic reporting infrastructure state
  • Propose, build, and develop tactical and strategic enhancements to the reporting infrastructure
  • Repurpose and rebuild the existing VBA-based reports to the strategic model/infrastructure
  • Enhance Tableau-based reports, and optimise existing reports
  • Co-ordinate project plans, and work with key IT and Risk Management stakeholders to drive deliverables to completion
  • Automate various daily tasks involved in the current reporting infrastructure, including implementation of control frameworks and best-practise checks
  • Provide support to the Risk Managers on day to day running of risk reports
  • Regularly update and clearly communicate progress and milestones with GRM management/users

What do you need to succeed?

 Must-have

  • Strong leadership skills and vision ; proven record of leading a team/project and delivering value-added results
  • Hands on experience working on large datasets and databases
  • Ability to understand and clearly communicated around highly complicated reporting infrastructure dependencies related to books of complex derivatives portfolios
  • Proficient in VBA/Python/SQL
  • Hands-on experience of Tableau
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills ; is able to articulate ideas, thought processes, and recommendations confidently and rationally to senior audiences
  • Relevant experience working with Group Risk Management/Trading at a top-tier financial company
  • Good understanding of the day-to-day responsibilities of Market Risk, and daily risk reporting
  • Preferable knowledge of derivatives and greeks for interest rate and equity option products, Stress testing and scenario analysis and value-at-Risk measurement

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businessses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

The person will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. The person should be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required. The person should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Job Title

Director- Data & Analytics COE

Job Description

  • Lead a team of data product owners, balance long-term vision and near-term delivery to design, build and scalable suite with a focus in enabling process insights delivery through Operations Product Hub “Process 360” and machine learning enabled product suite focusing on unstructured operations data insights.
  • Collaborate with P&CB Data Strategy, Canadian Data Asset team, T&O Partners and other enterprise and P&CB data leaders to develop vision, strategy and deliver “One PATH” to create the PCB data foundation to enable RBC\'s utilization of data in a safe, timely, efficient and meaningful way, enabling various P&CB Mega Journey on data & insights.
  • Manage the financial management cycle for the data product portfolio (annual budgeting, monthly forecast/update for AppDev and Other NIE) to ensure actual spend is within RBC acceptable variance against the IRB approved plan.
  • Lead the development of the measurement framework to define and quantify the benefits of data product investment and reusability.
  • Build and maintain the partnership and relationship with a broad range of partners: CBO, T&O, P&CB lines of business, GRM and other functional partners.

Must- have:

  • Master\'s or Ph.D. in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or other quantitative disciplines
  • 7+ Years in data & analytics leadership roles, 5+ Years of experience managing teams.
  • 5+ Years Product Management experience including managing a roadmap, building and launching data products & capabilities to support investment decisions
  • 5+ Years of experience with big data technologies, experience in Machine-Learning, data mining and statistics.
  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data science technologies.
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, familiar with a range of data tools, work experience with complex visualization of data.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal); ability to communicate with people in a wide variety of areas and at various levels from technical specialists to executives


Nice to- have:

  • Knowledge of Python, R, Java and SQL
  • Knowledge in data extraction, transformation, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Knowledge with big data technologies - Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark

Job Summary

RBC Canadian Banking Operations (CBO) plays a unique role in enabling Envision 2024, Personal & Commercial Banking’s strategy. The strategic use of data to deliver business value is one of the three Big Rocks that constitutes the CBO business strategy and the CBO Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence (COE) plays a leadership role in developing the CBO data strategy to deliver and embed actionable insights to day-to-day decision making across CBO.
The Data & Analytics COE is hiring a Director, Data & Analytics COE. You will have the opportunity to play a leadership role in driving forward the design and delivery of a suite of insight-driven data products with key P&CB, Technology and Functional partners to enable P&CB Mega Journeys and CBO strategy.

item.title: Associate Director, Credit Risk Analytics and Modeling
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Credit Risk Analytics and Modeling

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Associate Director, Credit Risk Analytics and Modeling will support the development and monitoring of RBC’s Retail AIRB (Advanced Internal Ratings Based) regulatory capital parameters from a data analytics and portfolio management perspective. 

What will you do?

  • Participate in design sessions to provide input, gather and document requirements, and help formulate analytical frameworks to develop effective risk model calibration and reporting that creates robust business intelligence
  • Manage in an iterative manner the creation and improvement upon model monitoring and regulatory reporting processes and data
  • Lead, as a subject matter expert, in all manner of data mining activities (activities include, but are not limited to data analysis, aggregation, business insights, interpretation and recommendation)
  • Investigate industry leading data tools and methods to be leveraged in data mining, analysis & visualization
  • Participate actively in the exchange of knowledge relating to parameter estimation, data, portfolio management and analytical methodology 
  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to
  • Provide data Governance expertise ensuring linkage across all sources and all reporting produced to optimize accuracy, efficiencies and manage redundancies
  • Provide analytical support on Ad Hoc requests originating from various stakeholders 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong credit risk modeling knowledge and good lending products data acumen
  • Strong data manipulation capability and analytical skills with advanced SQL programming skills; experience in SAS/Python or similar tools; expertise with MS Office Suite.
  • Effective and equally conversant in translating technical expertise into business language that drive insights
  • At least 3 years working experience with lending products and related databases
  • Advanced knowledge and working experience with data management and data visualization using tools including Tableau

Nice-to-have

  • Degree in quantitative field of study (e.g. Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science) – to demonstrate capability for critical thinking and data analysis
  • Experience in the Financial industry
  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment
  • Expertise in navigating an Enterprise Data Warehouse, experience with Hadoop environments, Python, R or other tools

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, and competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities       
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

The Associate Director, Credit Risk Analytics and Modeling will support the development and monitoring of RBC’s Retail AIRB (Advanced Internal Ratings Based) regulatory capital parameters from a data analytics and portfolio management perspective.

You will focus on the preparation of the data ingested for modeling Retail parameters: PD/LGD/EAD, and back-testing of the parameter performance. You will assist the Director, Credit Risk Analytics and Modeling in the execution and maintenance of tools and processes that support model development and performance monitoring. You will assist Senior Management and the Board in understanding critical parameter estimation issues relating to credit risk parameters.

We are looking for a bright, committed, high-performing individual to become a key contributor on the data and analytics side of quantitative model development. We are a team that prides itself for high quality work with significant impact across the bank and continuous interaction with other groups, senior management and regulators. Given the nature of our work, the opportunity to learn, grow and expand your network is significant.

item.title: Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission

What is the opportunity?

Ownr is seeking a talented, experienced and passionate Product Manager focused on customer insights, Data & Analytics to join our growing team. In this role you will work across the business to support and manage the execution of data-related products and projects to help drive our customer understanding and cross-functional capabilities. We are looking for vocal futurists who have a passion for technology and are inspired by the idea of bringing to life product roadmaps that benefit hundreds of thousands of people at a key milestone in their lives.

About Ownr

At Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We\'re on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.

 

What you will do

  • Help set the product vision and strategy for data, analytics, and customer insights
  • Own the translation of business requirements, you will execute to deliver solutions that expand our data and analytics capabilities across multiple portfolios.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, building dashboards, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Responsible for creating and managing quality data products, processes and services to ensure growth and achievement of our business goals.
  • Understand our key drivers, customer use cases, and full user flow impact across all platforms.
  • Create, manage, and maintain KPI\'s to monitor, analyze and improve conversion
  • Lead the product planning and development process through backlog grooming, refinement, and prioritization activities
  • Define and detail User Stories and prioritize team backlogs in accordance to our business drivers.
  • Evaluate and document the requirements for each product feature, articulate these requirements, answer questions and make scope trade-off decisions as needed.
  • Ensure optimal delivery by removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance and develop contingency plans to demonstrate adaptability while supporting continuous learning.
  • Bridge technical, business and creative worlds, engaging with matrixed teams including development, UX/UI design, copy, legal, risk and compliance, creating a collaborative environment while maximizing on business return.
  • Drive internal stakeholders and cross-functional business unit engagements necessary for an optimal on-time launch.
  • Focus on backend functionality as well as user-facing features that make world-class user engaging platforms.

 

Skills you\'ll need to succeed

 Must have

  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).
  • Experience working as a Product Manager in a SaaS environment.
  • Proven work experience in data product management (growth-stage company experience a plus) and working with agile teams and organizations.
  • Experience translating business requirements to actionable software solutions.
  • In-depth knowledge of agile processes and principles, with the ability to provide direction to the agile team and stakeholders throughout.
  • Extensive experience developing use cases, epics and stories in a clear and concise manner, enabling the engineering team to deliver maximum productivity and value
  • Experience maintaining and prioritizing the backlog in accordance to business and technology drivers.
  • Experience in the planning of product releases and setting expectations for delivery of new functionality.
  • A Proven ability to make hard decisions in a fast-paced environment, while actively identifying and mitigating issues that have an impact on successful completion of goals.
  • Ability to speak to business functions, customers and partners with confidence and professionalism.
  • Commitment to winning as a team.
  • An entrepreneurial & innovative spirit

 

Nice to have

  • Experience with the development process, use of tools like GitHub
  • Experience using analytics tools such as: SQL, Amplitude, and Metabase

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options

 Launching and running a business can be daunting. But, at Ownr, we bring entrepreneurs closer to their dreams.

 

We have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. Our industry-leading tools, resources, and ongoing support make it as easy as possible for entrepreneurs to start and succeed.

 

VSPRODUCT

RBC Ventures

The data protection team is at the forefront of delivering actionable insider threat and analytics services. Using data science practices tied to web and analytics services it helps highlight actionable events for ongoing investigations.

As the lead developer, you will be accountable for extending and enhancing current application services while working closely with product owners to develop and link together various components with a focus on overall fidelity of data models, optimization, product design and delivering enhancements as part of current managed web analytics services. Manager, Data Analysis, Decision Mgmt

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

We are hiring a Manager, Data Analytics In this role, you will be the subject matter expert for Cards, Payments & Banking Data, playing a key role in driving superior business results, by enabling product managers to have access to data and insights through analytics reports and dashboards on new and existing business opportunities.  Champion the use of deep analytic rigour as the basis for the decision management methodology and leverage all available sources of data to create value within the business.

What will you do? Become the data subject matter expert (SME) for CP&B and BFS in support of CEBA Program.

  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to create & support reports and insights material for tracking the CEBA program
  • Perform data analysis and communicate meaningful insights that inform strategy and action
  • Seek opportunities to automate and streamline analytics and reporting steps

  • Transform the way Cards, Payments and Banking uses data by developing advanced reporting and analytics to serve external and internal clients.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

item.title: Director Credit Modeling and Methodology
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director Credit Modeling and Methodology

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology will lead the development of RBC’s Wholesale AIRB (Advanced Internal Ratings Based) regulatory capital parameters from a data infrastructure perspective.

You will focus on leading a team building out the infrastructure for data ingested for modeling Wholesale parameters: PD, LGD and EAD monitoring and development. You will assist the Senior Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology in the execution and maintenance of tools and processes that support model development and performance monitoring.  You will assist Senior Management and the Board in understanding critical parameter estimation issues relating to credit risk parameters.

We are looking for a strong high-performing leader to become a key partner on the data side of quantitative model development. We are a team that prides itself for high quality work with significant impact across the bank and continuous interaction with other groups, senior management and regulators. Given the nature of our work, the opportunity to learn, grow and expand your network is significant. 

What will you do?

  • Manage in an iterative manner the creation and improvement upon Wholesale processes and credit risk data used at RBC

  • Lead a team of qualified subject matter experts in all manner of data analytics

  • Investigate industry leading data tools and methods to be leveraged in data mining, analysis & visualization

  • Participate actively in the exchange of knowledge relating to parameter estimation, data & analytical methodology 

  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to

  • Provide data Governance expertise ensuring linkage across all sources and all reporting produced to optimize accuracy, efficiencies and manage redundancies

  • Provide analytical support on Ad Hoc requests originating from various stakeholders

 What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong leadership capabilities to provide mentorship to a team of data analytics professionals

  • Wholesale credit risk modeling knowledge and lending products data acumen

  • Strong data manipulation capability with advanced SQL programming skills; experience in SAS, Python or similar tools

  • Effective and equally conversant in translating technical expertise into business language that drive insights

  • At least 5 years working experience with lending products and related databases

  • Advanced knowledge and working experience with relational databases and data visualization tools

 Nice-to-have

  • Degree in quantitative field of study (e.g. Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science) – to demonstrate capability for critical thinking and data analysis

  • Experience in the Financial industry

  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment

  • Expertise in navigating an Enterprise Data Warehouse, experience with Hadoop environments, Python, R or other tools

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program

  • Leaders who support your development through training and coaching

  • Work with a dynamic, collaborative team with ability to make a difference

Job Summary

Lead the team responsible for data infrastructure used in Wholesale Parameter Estimation, a process that generates ~$200bn RWA. Accountable for the analysis and oversight of the data behind Wholesale parameters.

Product Analyst

What is the opportunity?

The DNA (Data & Analytics) group is responsible for enabling and implementing RBC’s Data Vision across all platforms. We build data-driven services and platforms aimed to serve our clients better. This opportunity is for a Product Analyst role on the Enterprise Client product. The role is reporting to the Director Product Analysis and Quality and is responsible for execution of all aspects of requirements delivery, elicitation, analysis, documentation, and reporting needs. 

What will you do?

  • Business analysis including stakeholder analysis to identify impacted groups and facilitate requirements discovery, analysis and review, management of risks,  interdependencies, assumptions and constraints for requirements

  • Data analysis into the data warehouse and other data sources to better understand (to uncover) possible join issues, data resolution issues, and missing data prior to serving productionize data to consumers

  • Partner with the Product and Business Architects, and Technology teams to communicate business needs and explore, assess and recommend value-add solution options to support business strategies

  • Collaborate with Product team and stakeholders to ensure effective delivery of product features

  • Work with Product team to provide updates and supporting materials for key meetings, presentations on progress, and support the completion of monthly Business Review Document (BRD) and  Privacy/Governance/Risk documents

  • Participate in effort estimation at product level (distill requirements so that the tech teams can easily understand)

  • Work with Quality engineering team to support testing to ensure quality of  deliverables

  • Support execution of Agile processes (Sprint planning, Sprint Retro, Backlog refinement, Sprint Review), and ensure Jira/ Confluence are up to date.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ years of experience working in the areas of requirements management and data (Financial Services Industry preferred)

  • Experience in requirements planning and prioritization including stakeholder analysis and effort estimation

  • Strong analytical thinking skills; Strong communication skills- written and verbal; Strong collaboration skills

  • Good at writing SQL queries

  • Relevant Undergrad degree

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with data transformation initiatives

  • Experience working in a large corporate environment

  • Familiarity with SDLC, platform, software, analytics, business intelligence technology, agile methodology

  • Knowledge on Hadoop/Hive/Zeppelin/Elastic Search Kibana/HDFS/Ambari/Kafka/Apigee/Spark

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

    • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

    • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

    • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

    • A world-class training program in financial services

    • Flexible work/life balance options

    • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities    

    • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.title: Data Analyst, Corporate Client Group
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analyst, Corporate Client Group

Job Description

Please note, this is a Canada-wide opportunity.

What is the opportunity?

This technical role is part of Corporate Client Group (CCG) National Operation’s Data Analytics team who delivers and maintains CCG’s management information systems, creates meaningful data visualizations and improves reporting processes. You require critical thinking, strong technical skills, effective project management and great attention to detail to ensure success in this role. RBC CCG National Operations supports CCG planning, directing, and overseeing their operational policies, rules, initiatives, and goals.  The CCG team is responsible for meeting annually established targets for revenues and returns, providing advice to our partners along with broader RBC relationship goals, while the National Operations team helps & supports the group execute long-term and short-term plans.  

What will you do?

  • Analyze large datasets in Excel and SQL; create ad-hoc and periodic reporting that are accurate and timely; and document and diagram key data management processes
  • Create and maintain robust databases in SQL Server and MS Access
  • Build meaningful data visualizations in Tableau and Excel for performance reporting
  • Support all CCG teams nationally and senior management to provide data and analytics solutions that support data driven decisions
  • Utilize VBA, SQL and other programming languages to make database and reporting processes more efficient
  • Perform database administrative duties including database maintenance, manage ETL processes, data cleanups and proactively monitor data quality
  • Manage Data Analytic team’s JIRA service desk and Confluence

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Undergraduate or equivalent degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Management Information Systems with knowledge and experience in database and data management principals
  • Minimum of 2 years of professional work experience in a business intelligence, data analytics, or data warehousing
  • Professional verbal and written communication skills
  • Intermediate knowledge and experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools, as well as, advanced level of MS Office (with a focus on Excel and Access), SQL and VBA
  • Ability to solve problems through creativity and critical thinking, strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Proven capabilities in effective management of tasks and delivering high quality work while performing well under pressure, meeting time sensitive deadlines, and prioritizing work

Nice to have:

  • Database Administration Experience
  • Python, C programming, Java

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Learn and develop new technical skills in a team that supports creativity and thinking outside of the box
  • Improve organizational skills including business analysis, project coordination and effective communication
  • Exposure to fast paced high performing teams and senior management
  • Work in a dynamic and collaborative organization that supports personal and professional growth
  • Flexible working environment with WFH hybrid model
  • Opportunities to learn and grow through challenging work
  • Being part of a great organization that values inclusion and diversity

item.description:

Job Title

Snr Manager, Data Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Management, RBC Global Asset Management (GAM), you will partner with business leaders, data governance and project teams to ensure the completeness and accuracy of enterprise data within Global Asset Management, with a focus on one or more assigned data domains. Build trust and confidence across the organization around enterprise data and data processes. This position will play an important role in GAM’s vision to become a data driven firm, and will serve as a go-to expert for the data that is managed by GAM’s Data Governance, and how to leverage it for business value. For more information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com/en/ca/

What will you do?

  • Accountable for one or more specific enterprise data domains, you will work across the organization to understand enterprise data needs, data requirements and usage. Conduct research related to data requirements and present proposals to appropriate teams. Where needed, work across multiple business teams to achieve consensus on key data decisions including sourcing, classifications, and definitions.

  • Lead the work of one or more Data Working Groups, minute decisions and provide input to the Data Governance Council for key decisions that need to be escalated.

  • Define accountability for making data decisions – raise issues, risks and business decisions to appropriate teams.

  • Prioritize data work to ensure optimal value across projects and the organization

  • Join an agile data squad and provide guidance on data definitions, locations, and workflows.

  • Work with data squads to document and translate data requirements into technical requirements

  • Join an agile data squad and provide guidance on data within the organization.

  • In partnership with the data governance disciplines, business teams and business technology:

    • Document data definitions, create data quality controls and monitors

    • Develop data integration processes

    • Define operational workflows for maintaining data

    • Plan for data staging and delivery to reporting and downstream applications

  • Communicate regularly with project and business teams on data readiness and to identify data gaps and new requirement

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, IT/MIS/CS or related experience

  • Demonstrated reporting, data analysis experience, especially working with complex business processes and specific data domains

  • Strong communication, interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with business users and technical individuals

Nice to Have

  • Experience working in financial investment industry ideally within an asset management group

item.title: Senior Analyst, Source Document Operations
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Source Document Operations

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

At Royal Bank of Canada and its subsidiaries (RBC) data is considered a critical asset, as valuable as the organization’s financial assets. Effective management and governance of RBC’s data generates valuable insights for our clients and communities, enhances transparency with regulators, and empowers sound investment decisions to expand business activities.

As a Senior Analyst, Source Document Operations within the Enterprise Data Governance Operations (EDGO) of the Chief Data Office (CDO), you will have the opportunity to support the implementation of standardized processes and tools to ensure complete and consistent source documentation exists for transactions related to the firm’s regulatory reporting processes. The EDGO functions as a ‘Second Line of Defense’ within RBC’s ‘Three Lines of Defense’ model, performing monitoring of risk and control in support of RBC’s operational risk management objectives and EDGO’s strategic objectives.

This instrumental role will work in a team of professionals that support our ‘First Line’ partners in the lines of business and functions by focusing on implementing a sustainable process for tracing regulatory reporting data back to original source documentation, ensuring that reporting data is easily verified against original sources when requested during audit or regulatory examinations.

The role will report to the Head of Regulatory Remediation and provide exciting opportunities to interact with EDGO leadership and collaborate with business and function partners across the organization, learning and evaluating their data reporting and other key processes, providing independent viewpoints to enhance data traceability practices to manage risk, and forming collaborative relationships along the way.

What will you do?

  • Facilitate collaboration between reporting teams and lines of business to identify source systems and source document owners
  • Perform reviews of source documentation to ensure documentation is sufficient to support regulatory reporting transactions selected for testing
  • Maintain source document catalog to support the documentation and related attributes necessary to fulfill transaction testing requests
  • Document observations, exceptions, and enhancement recommendations resulting from review of documentation to support transaction testing requests

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • 7+ years of progressive experience supporting data lineage processes, transaction testing processes, regulatory reporting processes, or financial reporting processes
  • Experience performing data management or governance processes in a large financial institution or other large organization in a regulated industry
  • Strong written and oral communication and presentation skills with proven ability to manage ambiguity and drive successful outcomes
  • Strong collaboration and relationship management skills with proven ability to facilitate discussion and build consensus with partners in the EDGO, lines of business and functions
  • Undergraduate or Graduate Degree in Business, Information Technology, or related field

Nice-to-have:

  • Working knowledge of key banking products such as loans, leases, deposits, securities financing transactions, and derivatives
  • Familiarity of data, privacy, compliance and regulatory risk management practices in the financial services or other regulated industry
  • Familiarity of functional and control areas in Banking and/or Capital Markets
  • Effective time management and organizational skills to meet tight timeframes, as well as flexibility to adapt to changing priorities

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater responsibilities

Job Title

Senior Officer, Data Management (Fixed Term Contract)

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

During this 12 month fixed term contract you will be working as part of the Data Management & Quality team. The purpose of the role is to ensure that all Client and Product data is input, controlled effectively and maintained appropriately for all WMI businesses and product lines.

What will you do?

  • Ensure the integrity of data across and between multiple systems is maintained
  • Assist with Data Management tasks and projects as directed by Senior Associates, Manager of the Data Management team and the Manager of Data Standards & Control.
  • Collaborate with colleagues to ensure that all issues, queries and obstacles are satisfactorily resolved to ensure that tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner
  • Assist with the timely completion of Data Remediation projects.

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Strong communication skills
  • Collaborative and consultative approach along with team player attitude
  • Ability to make decisions, use initiative and escalate issues
  • Ability to execute tasks within defined service level agreements
  • A proven track record in excellent service delivery
  • Knowledge/experience with Client Due Diligence (CDD) / Know Your Client (KYC) and supporting documentation
  • Ability and willingness to work from home in line with the hybrid working team charter

Nice-to-have

  • An understanding of client structures, primarily companies and trusts
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office products — specifically Word and Excel
  • Knowledge and understanding of Salesforce, RIBS, Milvus, Triple A, 5 Series, and Content Navigator
